### Tender for a Telecommunication Shelter, Radio Frequency Antenna, and Electrical Installation

The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) intends to award a contract for the installation of a Telecommunication Shelter, Radio Frequency antennas, and electrical work at the Picton, Ontario site. This is the first phase (Phase one) of a two-phase competition where all bidders will be evaluated based on mandatory requirements. The pre-qualified bidders will then proceed to Phase two, where they will provide a financial bid for the project. The selected contractor will perform and complete the work by March 31, 2024.

### Evaluation Criteria

The RCMP will evaluate the pre-qualified bidders' compliance with the mandatory requirements and then select the contractor with the lowest price. The evaluation criteria include:

* Compliance with mandatory requirements
* Price
* Security requirements

### Procurement Information

This procurement is managed through the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) at [http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders](http://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/tenders). All amendments, significant enquiries, and their replies will be posted on the website. Bidders are expected to regularly consult the website for the most up-to-date information.

### Indigenous Procurement

The RCMP is committed to supporting Indigenous Businesses and encourages Canadian businesses to register in the Indigenous Business Directory (IBD) to increase their visibility and competitiveness.
